Warning Â¶

A mirror of Facebookâs Warning

UsageÂ¶

npm install warning

// some script
var warning = require('warning');

var ShouldBeTrue = false;

warning(
  ShouldBeTrue,
  'This thing should be true but you set to false. No soup for you!'
);
//  'This thing should be true but you set to false. No soup for you!'

Similar to Facebookâs (FB) invariant but only logs a warning if the condition is not met. This can be used to log issues in development environments in critical paths. Removing the logging code for production environments will keep the same logic and follow the same code paths.

FAQ (READ before opening an issue)Â¶

Why do you use console.error instead of console.warn ?

This is a mirror of Facebookâs (FB) warning module used within Reactâs source code (and other FB software). As such this module will mirror their code as much as possible.

The descision to use error over warn was made a long time ago by the FB team and isnât going to change anytime soon.

The source can be found here: https://github.com/facebook/fbjs/blob/master/packages/fbjs/src/forks/warning.js The reasoning can be found here and elsewhere: https://github.com/facebook/fbjs/pull/94#issuecomment-168332326

Can I add X feature?

This is a mirror of Facebookâs (FB) warning and as such the source and signature will mirror that module.

If you believe a feature is missing than please open a feature request there. If it is approved and merged in that this module will be updated to reflect that change, otherwise this module will not change.

Use in ProductionÂ¶

It is recommended to add babel-plugin-dev-expression with this module to remove warning messages in production.
